data.name: description
data.label: Description
data.help: Add a thorough description with as much detail as possible. You can use [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/basics). You can change the description at any time. If you provide personal data, please note that it will remain in the transaction history. For more information on how personal data is handled within the metadata, please refer to our [privacy policy](/privacy/en).

data.name: files
data.label: File
data.help: Please enter the URL to your data set file and click "ADD FILE" to validate the data. This URL will be stored encrypted after publishing. For a compute data set, your file should match the file type required by the algorithm, and should not exceed 1 GB in file size.

data.name: links
data.label: Sample file
data.help: Please enter the URL to a sample of your data set file and click "ADD FILE" to validate the data. This file should reveal the data structure of your data set, e.g. by including the header and one line of a CSV file. This file URL will be publicly available after publishing.

data.name: access
data.label: Access Type
data.help: Choose how you want your files to be accessible for the specified price.
data.disclaimer: Please do not provide downloadable personal data without the consent of the data subjects.

data.name: providerUri
data.label: Custom Provider URL
data.help: Enter the URL for your custom provider or leave blank to use the default provider. [Learn more](https://github.com/oceanprotocol/provider/).

data.name: timeout
data.label: Timeout
data.help: Define how long buyers should be able to download the data set again after the initial purchase.

data.name: dataTokenOptions
data.label: Datatoken Name & Symbol
data.help: The datatoken for this data set will be created with this name & symbol.

data.name: author
data.label: Author
data.help: Give proper attribution for your data set. You are welcome to use a pseudonym, and you can change your author name at any time. Please note that it will remain in the transaction history. For more information on how personal data is handled within the metadata, please refer to our [privacy policy](/privacy/en).

data.name: termsAndConditions
data.label: Terms & Conditions
options: I agree to these Terms and Conditions
